content: github recently gave the rust-lang org private alpha access to a new feature for issues: issue forms!

they allow creating things like this https://github.com/rust-lang/docs.rs/issues/new?assignees=&labels=limits-increase&template=sandbox-limits-increase-request.yaml, instead of creating forms using html comments
if y'all are interested in trying them on the cargo repo feel free to! the documentation is here: https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/rust-lang-issue-forms--BKvbUVhzvjTjmTB369vFlIoFAg-nqAnaBLp1oV5Ojv8W4f6V
oooh, fancy! Thanks for the heads up!
no problem! if you see other teams that might benefit from this feel free to share the doc, as long as they record the repo they enable forms in the doc
(it's only enabled in the rust-lang org though)
@Pietro Albini That's really awesome, thank you!
Very first reaction: It'd be really nice if the preview tab still existed, and showed what the resulting rendered markdown looked like, since some fields accept markdown.
It looks like the textarea input has a preview, which I think is probably sufficient. I don't think people would typically get too creative in a single-line input.
Ah, fair enough. But still, it'd be nice to see the whole thing in rendered form, for when you've finished writing everything and you want to see if you've told the story you're trying to tell.

@Pietro Albini Very cool! What does the generated output look like? Can you control what it is generated?

My first impression is that it would be nice in rust-lang/rust for bug reports a separate “Backtrace” text box instead of having to know to paste your backtrace inside the summary HTML.
Ah so it isn’t customisable atm? That’s a shame. I was hoping that you could give it a template, and it uses moustache or something to format their answer into the issue.
I'm not sure about a full template, but a hide_in_details: true would indeed be useful for backtraces and such
